Radial 2D plot class¶

class radial_2D_plot.radial_2D_plot(ps_axis)¶

A concrete subclass of NM_image that produces displacement vs depth 2D plots for an individual mode.

__init__(ps_axis)¶
Parameters

ps_axis (ps_axis object) – ps_axis object that holds specifications for the details of the plot

_add_figure_details(W, W_max)¶

Adds all the bells and whistles to the figure like zerocrossing lines etc :param W: Displacement values as a function of radius :type W: 1D Numpy array

Parameters

W_max (float) – Maximum magnitude of displacement in array (must be positive).

_format_figure_metadata(W_max)¶

Updates axes artists like the title/axes limits etc

Parameters

W_max (float) – Maximum magnitude of displacement in array (must be positive).

_integrate_mode(n, l, omega)¶

Not sure if we will use this function. TBC.

_load_data()¶

Module called in _prepare_plot(). Expected file format is single column of data with first 3 lines are N, L, Omega. Next lines are displacement/sensitivity at (increasing/decreasing) depth

_make_polar_axis(specs)¶

Generates and adds a matplotlib polar axes to the figure.

Parameters

specs (ps_axis object) – Specifications for the plot type to know which location to generate the axis on matplotlib figure

_produce_plot()¶

First-order function that produces the plot on the relevant Matplotlib axis.

init_anim_data()¶

Initialises data values for first frame of an animation.

update_anim_data(iteration)¶

Function is used to update MPL artists (e.g. a 2DLine object) as part of animations for given iteration value see _gen_animations() in ps_figure.py

Parameters

iteration (int) – Iteration step for animations
